reg:regulation.reg:title:
Interactive Digital Media Tax Credit
Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 25/2012, September 1, 2010]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Income Tax Act;
cutscene means an animated or live action scene or series of scenes relating to a video game

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that is included in or distributed with the video game,
over which the user of the video game has limited or no control, and
that is used to advance the plot or provide character development, background information, a story line, context or clues.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In Part 10 of the Act, eligible activity, in relation to an interactive digital media product, means an activity attributable to the development of the interactive digital media product, but does not include the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an activity attributable to the development of an animated or live action scene or series of scenes relating to an interactive digital media product, other than a cutscene, over which the user of the interactive digital media product has limited or no control.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of the definition of "interactive digital media product" in section 132 of the Act, the following products are prescribed as not included in the meaning of interactive digital media product:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a product designed to be used by individuals for interactive communication;
a product classified by the Entertainment Software Rating Board as "AO" (adults only);
a product designed for marketing or promoting an entity, product or idea;
a product for which public financial support would, in the opinion of the minister, be contrary to public policy.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purpose of section 136 (2) (c) of the Act, the prescribed application fee that a corporation must provide is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the corporation has 5 or more employees but fewer than 10 employees at the end of the corporation's previous fiscal period, $2 500;
if the corporation has 10 or more employees at the end of the corporation's previous fiscal period, $5 000.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Income Tax Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 215, sections 96 and 140.]
